metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1520 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
When viewing an email message A, which contains an attached message B, where B is encrypted or digitally signed or both, Thunderbird may show an incorrect encryption or signature status. After opening and viewing the attached message B, when returning to the display of message A, the message A might be shown with the security status of message B. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
